paper_title: Construction of 2D/2D Bi2Se3/g-C3N4 nanocomposite with High interfacial charge separation and photo-heat conversion efficiency for selective photocatalytic CO2 reduction

catalyst.source: g-C3N4 powder was synthesized by the conventional polymerization method.
catalyst.context: J o u r n a l P r e -p r o o f 2.1.1 Materials Bismuth (III) nitrate pentahydrate, selenium dioxide, polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, Mw40000), sodium hydroxide, melamine and ethylene glycol were purchased from the Sinopharm Chemistry Reagent Corporation (Shanghai, China) and analytical grade. Firstly, Poly (N-vinyl-2-pyrrolidone) (PVP, Mw40000) (0.8 g) was dissolved in ethylene glycol (40mL).Then certain amounts of Bi(NO3)35H2O and SeO2 were introduced into the above solution, followed by the addition of 2 mL NaOH solution (5 mol/L).After fiercely stirring for half an hour, the mixed solution was transferred, sealed in a Teflon vessel, and then treated at 230 C for 40 min.After cooling down to the room temperature, the as-prepared particles were collected by centrifugation and washed with deionized water and ethanol.Finally, it was dried at 60 C for 6 h in vacuum oven. g-C3N4 powder was synthesized by the conventional polymerization method.To be specific, 20 g melamine were put in crucible and then thermally treated at 550 C for 4 h.Then, the obtained yellow particles were ground for fine powders and washed, dried at 60 C for 6 h. To be specific, 1g of pre-synthesized g-C3N4 were dispersed in 200 mL ethanol/deionized water mixed solution via ultrasonication about 1 h.After that, a certain amounts of Bi2Se3 were introduced into the above solution with further ultrasonication for 12 h.Finally, the samples was collected by centrifugation and dried at 60 C.The additions of Bi2Se3 in composite were 150, 100, 50, and 30 mg, named as 15BSCN, 10BSCN, 5BSCN and 3BSCN, respectively. J o u r n a l P r e -p r o o f The structure of the samples was studied by X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis (D/MAX-RB). X-ray photo-electron spectroscopy (XPS) data were collected with ESCALAB II XPS system. All spectra were calibrated by 284.5 eV of C 1s.To obtain the shape of the particles, the analyses of scanning electron microscope (SEM) were carried out on Hitachi S4800 and JSM-5610LV.The structure and morphology of the samples were further measured by transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM).The surface functional groups of the specimens were checked by Thermo Nicolet Nexus spectrometer combined In-situ test equipment.PL emission spectra were obtained by a fluorescence spectrophotometer (RF-5301PC).The UV-vis diffuse reflectance (DRS) spectra of the materials were tested by UV-2550 (Shimadzu, Japan). The photocatalytic performance of the samples was investigated by the reduction of CO2 with H2O using 300 W Xe lamp as irradiation source, carrying out in a self-designed glassware photoreactor (volume 500 mL).Desired amount (50 mg) of particles and an appropriate amount of water was added into a glass culture dish (60 mm), ultrasonically spread the sample evenly and then placed the culture dish in an oven for drying.Prior to light irradiation, the reactor was vacuum treated, and then the CO2 in reactor was produced by the reaction of NaHCO3 and concentrated H2SO4.After that, 3 mL deionized water were injected into the reactor followed by the switch on of light.At given interval time, 200 L of reacted gas were withdrawn to check products using GC-7820.The detailed process of photocatalytic reduction of CO2 is shown in figure S1. The electronic properties of the samples were calculated by the Vienna ab initio simulation package (VASP) referred to DFT with PBE functional of GGA.The unit cell parameters of the samples were optimized with the residual force of less than 0.05 eV/A, the iterative energy variation was less than 10 -5 eV, and the cutoff energy of wave functions was set as 500 eV.

co-catalyst.context: The 2D/2D Bi2Se3/g-C3N4 composite has been successfully prepared by a facile method.The surface of 2D g-C3N4 presented strong inherent interactions with that of 2D Bi2Se3 in composite J o u r n a l P r e -p r o o f so that the charge could be effectively transferred between them.The addition of Bi2Se3 made the light absorption of g-C3N4 extend into the whole wavelength of light covering UV, visible and NIR light.In this case, 2D/2D Bi2Se3/g-C3N4 composite exhibited excellent low concentration of CO2 reduction ability under the irradiation of full spectrum, which is much better than those of solely Bi2Se3 and g-C3N4.More importantly, the reduction of CO2 to CO demonstrated nearly 100 selectivity.The superiority of Bi2Se3/g-C3N4 composite over other counterparts should be due to two reasons.Firstly, Bi2Se3 acted as like a cocatalyst with suitable fermi level and tightly combined with g-C3N4 so that the charge separation of g-C3N4 could be significantly improved;
